intro: Barringtonia baramensis, commonly known as the Baram River hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces a unique, spiky fruit that contains a single large seed. It is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. The leaves are large, palmately lobed, and often have a waxy coating.
